  physical_appearance: This is an acknowledgement form stating receipt of letter. It is printed in black ink
 with the fields filled in with handwritten inscription in blue ink. There is a registered number at the top left corner. The date is written at the top-right corner. The form is signed at the bottom right corner in black ink
 above a purple stamp. There are no tears or folds seen on this document.

  context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery

  context_8: armed forces

  sgcool_label_text: Loose papers from the James Steele
 P.O.W archive that include a symbolic drawing
 Japanese banana money
 map of camp
 administrative papers from Changi prison pre-dating internment
 list of soldiers of a regiment as well as James Steele’s warrant to  join the army. These papers are part of the archive of James Steele
 Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942
 when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.

metadata.title_text: P.O.W. James Steele Archives: Army acknowledgement form Miscellaneous scraps of paper from P.O.W James Steele Archives (30 pieces)
metadata.physical_appearance: This is an acknowledgement form stating receipt of letter. It is printed in black ink, with the fields filled in with handwritten inscription in blue ink. There is a registered number at the top left corner. The date is written at the top-right corner. The form is signed at the bottom right corner in black ink, above a purple stamp. There are no tears or folds seen on this document.

metadata.context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
metadata.sgcool_label_text: Loose papers from the James Steele, P.O.W archive that include a symbolic drawing, Japanese banana money, map of camp, administrative papers from Changi prison pre-dating internment, list of soldiers of a regiment as well as James Steele’s warrant to  join the army. These papers are part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
